qas.question: What is the name given to the standard for measure and storing the loudness of an MP3 file?
What is measuring and storing loudness of an MP3 file also known as?
What does the standard ReplayGain allow a player to automatically adjust?
What program can be used to modify files based on ReplayGain measurements?
MP3Gain is important because it allows players without what capability to have adjusted playback?

context: <a0_0>ReplayGain<a0_0/> is a standard for measuring and storing the loudness of an MP3 file (<a1_0>audio normalization<a1_0/>) in its metadata tag, enabling a ReplayGain-compliant player to automatically adjust <a2_0>the overall playback volume<a2_0/> for each file. <a3_0>MP3Gain<a3_0/> may be used to reversibly modify files based on ReplayGain measurements so that adjusted playback can be achieved on players without <a4_0>ReplayGain capability<a4_0/>.
